name: Anatomy of a Song : Allentown Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the first verse, what are they closing down in Allentown?
questions.explanation:
Factories.

	Allentown is a city in Lehigh County, Pennsylvania. The iron industry resulted in the rapid expansion of the city in the 19th century.

questions.text: Also in the first verse, in which nearby city are they "killing time, filling out forms, standing in line?"
questions.explanation:
Bethlehem.

	Like nearby Allentown, Bethlehem found its wealth in heavy industry, before overseas competition after World War Two led to the closure of it's steel mills.

questions.text: In the second verse, in which war did "our fathers" fight?
questions.explanation:
Second World War.

	The Lehigh Valley area of Pennsylvania was a major supplier of steel and ordnance during World War Two. After the war, when Bethlehem Steel declined and eventually closed down, there was subsequent mass unemployment in the region.

questions.text: When they weren't fighting a war, where did "our fathers" spend their weekends?
questions.explanation:
Jersey Shore.

	The New Jersey shore is handily placed for residents of Eastern Pennsylavania to enjoy resorts such as Atlantic City and Asbury Park.

questions.text: Whilst enjoying their weekends, our fathers met our mothers at the USO. What does USO stand for?
questions.explanation:
United Service Organisations.

	United Service Organizations was founded in 1941 to provide "morale and recreation services" to members of the US military. Whilst many facilities  are located in overseas war zones, a large number are to be found on US soil.

questions.text: In the third verse, "we're waiting here in Allentown" for which place that "we never found"?
questions.explanation:
Pennsylvania.

	Pennsylvania is one of the original 13 colonies that founded the USA.  Allentown, located in the northeast of the state, is it's third largest city, after Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

questions.text: In the fourth verse, what items were hanging on the wall that "never really helped us at all"?
questions.explanation:
Graduations.

	"Allentown" was released as a single in 1982, reaching number 17 on the Billboard Hot 100. The original title of the song was going to be "Levittown", after Joel's home town on Long Island, New York.

questions.text: Joel lists a number of "real" items that they were never taught about. Which of the following was NOT one of these?
questions.explanation:
Tin.

	Iron, coke and steel are all part of the industrial heritage of the Allentown/Bethlehem area, but there is no history of tin mining in the area.

questions.text: What did they have thrown in their face?
questions.explanation:
An American Flag.

	Joel, having rejected Levittown as the title, was going to call the song "Bethlehem", but decided that people may mistake it for a religious song, so "Allentown" was actually the third choice for the song's title!

questions.text: The song "Allentown" originally appeared on which Billy Joel studio album?
questions.explanation:
The Nylon Curtain.

	"The Nylon Curtain", released in September, 1982, reached number seven on the Billboard album chart. Two other songs from the album were released as singles, "Pressure" and "Goodnight Saigon".
